1.text: He who isolates himself pursues selfish desires; he rebels against all sound judgment.

2.text: A fool does not delight in understanding, but only in airing his opinions.

3.text: With a wicked man comes contempt as well, and shame is accompanied by disgrace.

4.text: The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters; the fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.

5.text: Showing partiality to the wicked is not good, nor is depriving the innocent of justice.

6.text: A fool’s lips bring him strife, and his mouth invites a beating.

7.text: A fool’s mouth is his ruin, and his lips are a snare to his soul.

8.text: The words of a gossip are like choice morsels that go down into the inmost being.

9.text: Whoever is slothful in his work is brother to him who destroys.

10.text: The name of the LORD is a strong tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.

11.text: A rich man’s wealth is his fortified city; it is like a high wall in his imagination.

12.text: Before his downfall a man’s heart is proud, but humility comes before honor.

13.text: He who answers a matter before he hears it—this is folly and disgrace to him.

14.text: The spirit of a man can endure his sickness, but who can survive a broken spirit?

15.text: The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge, and the ear of the wise seeks it out.

16.text: A man’s gift opens doors for him, and brings him before great men.

17.text: The first to state his case seems right until another comes and cross-examines him.

18.text: Casting the lot ends quarrels and separates strong opponents.

19.text: An offended brother is harder to win than a fortified city, and disputes are like the bars of a castle.

20.text: From the fruit of his mouth a man’s belly is filled; with the harvest from his lips he is satisfied.

21.text: Life and death are in the power of the tongue, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

22.text: He who finds a wife finds a good thing and obtains favor from the LORD.

23.text: The poor man pleads for mercy, but the rich man answers harshly.

24.text: A man of many companions may come to ruin, but there is a friend who stays closer than a brother.
